hanzi-su-wiki:
菊

Значения

Хризантема, астра

Мнемоника

Внизу — пригоршня, столько зерна 米, сколько может захватить 勹 (охватить) рука. Травянистое 艹 растение, лепестки цветов которого похожи на растопыренные пальцы.

chrysanthemum

rtega_mnemonic:
菊菊RSchrysanthemum
  • flower 艹 which is just a handful 匊
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 匊 indicates the sound; 艹 (flower) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
菊花 [ jú huā ]: chrysanthemum; (slang) anus
菊花茶 [ jú huā chá ]: chrysanthemum tea
雏菊 [ chú jú ]: daisy
甘菊 [ gān jú ]: chamomile
菊科 [ jú kē ]: Asteraceae or Compositae (composites), a large family of dicotyledonous plants producing scents, includes aster, daisy and sunflower
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 匊 [ jū ] handful
heisig_chinese_memo: Chrysanthemum flower consists of many tiny petals, just like many rice grains bound up together.
heisig_constituent: chrysanthemum, flowers, rice cooker, bound up, rice
koohiiStory1: Chrysanthemum flower consists of many tiny petals, just like many rice grains bound up together.
koohiiStory2: [+astgt] Chrysanthemum is a terrorist orginization whose sole objective is to tie up Condi Rice. One day, Condi Rice is standing outside when a group of chrysanthemum agents swoop in from the sides, bound her up with chrysanthemum rope, and dash off. They leave a lone yellow chrysanthemum flower on top of the bound Condi Rice as a sign to let her discoverers know who committed this brave and noble act.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you pick certain rice or flowers you'll be put in prison. The most famous of these is the chrysanthemum. Chrysanthemums are super important in Japan because they're the symbol of the imperial family. They're even on the cover of Japanese passports. If you get caught picking a chrysanthemum, you're going to prison.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Chrysanthemums are really important to the Japanese people. Please don't ever pick them (or rice, because that's stealing food, someone planted that)!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you go to prison for chrysanthemum picking, everyone in the prison is going to kick (きく) you nonstop. You broke the chrysanthemum picking law, so kicking is your punishment. And believe me, you don't want these kicks.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine holding a chrysanthemum in your hands while you get kicked over and over and over in prison. Was it worth it?
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 鞠 (まり、キク мяч).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wrapped-up rice (匊) under the grass (艹) turns into a chrysanthemum
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Chrysanthemum flower consists of many tiny petals, just like many rice grains bound up together.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸", "匊" sound, often means chrysanthemum. "Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Reciting Songs": "Brow Jiangli and Ziju, I hope that spring will be embarrassing." Jin Taoqian "Returning Words": "Three paths are deserted, and pine and chrysanthemums still exist."

" Chrysanthemum " also means dianthus. "Shuowen": "Daju, Zingmai. Congyou, squeaking sound." "Erya Shicao": "Daju, Zingmai." Guo Pu's Note: "A ginger with a wheat sentence is dianthus."
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", "匊" sound, often means chrysanthemum.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「匊」聲，常表示菊花。《楚辭‧九章‧惜誦》：「播江離與滋菊兮，願春日以為糗芳。」晉陶潛〈歸去來兮辭〉：「三徑就荒，松菊猶存。」

　　「菊」也表示瞿麥。《說文》：「大菊，蘧麥。从艸，匊聲。」《爾雅‧釋草》：「大菊，蘧麥。」郭璞注：「一名麥句薑，即瞿麥。」

從「 艸 」，「 匊 」聲，常表示菊花。《楚辭‧九章‧惜誦》：「播江離與滋菊兮，願春日以為糗芳。」晉陶潛〈歸去來兮辭〉：「三徑就荒，松菊猶存。」 「 菊 」也表示瞿麥。《說文》：「大菊，蘧麥。从艸，匊聲。」《爾雅‧釋草》：「大菊，蘧麥。」郭璞注：「一名麥句薑，即瞿麥。」
From " 艸", " 匊" sound, often means chrysanthemum. "Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Reciting Songs": "Brow Jiangli and Ziju, I hope that spring will be embarrassing." Jin Taoqian "Returning Words": "Three paths are deserted, and pine and chrysanthemums still exist." " Chrysanthemum" also means dianthus. "Shuowen": "Daju, Zingmai. Congyou, squeaking sound." "Erya Shicao": "Daju, Zingmai." Guo Pu's Note: "A ginger with a wheat sentence is dianthus."

菊字的基本解释

菊
jú
多年生草本植物，秋天开花，是观赏植物，有的花可以入药，亦可作饮料：菊花。赏菊。春兰秋菊。
姓。

菊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jú］
［《廣韻》居六切，入屋，見。］
亦作“蘜1”。
(1)菊花。
(2)姓。宋时宫中有伶人菊夫人。见宋周密《齐东野语·菊花新曲破》。

菊字的英文翻译

◎ 菊
chrysanthemum

菊字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　菊； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1037第11
【唐韻】【韻會】?居六切，音掬。古作蘜、鞠。【爾雅】蘜，治蘠也。【郭註】今之秋華菊。【禮·月令】鞠有黃華。【屈原·離騷】夕餐秋菊之落英。　又水名。【水經注】湍水又南，菊水注之，水出西北石礀山芳菊谿。　又【韻補】訣力切。【賈島詩】九日不出門，十日見黃菊。灼灼耀繁英，美人無消息。【集韻】亦作蓻。

考證：〔【唐韻】【韻會】?居六切，音掬。古作蘜。【說文】蘜，治牆也。【郭註】今之秋華菊。【禮·月令】蘜有黃華。〕　謹按郭註係爾雅之註，今改說文爲爾雅。?照原文牆字改蘠字。月令蘜字改鞠字。古作蘜之下增鞠字。
菊字的源字形

菊字的起名意思

：指菊花。千姿百态的花朵，傲霜斗雪、独立寒秋、不畏严寒的性格使人倍加喜爱。梅、兰、菊、竹合称四君子。

chrysanthemum
Basic explanation of words
chrysanthemum
jú
A perennial herb that blooms in autumn and is an ornamental plant. Some flowers can be used as medicine or as a drink: chrysanthemum. Appreciating chrysanthemum. Chunlan Qiuju.
name.
chrysanthemum
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jú］
["Guangyun" lives in six cuts, enter the house, see you. ]
Also known as "蘜1".
(1) Chrysanthemum.
(2) Last name. There is Mrs. Ju, the actor in the Song Dynasty Palace. See Song Zhoumi's "The Wild Words of Qi Dong·New Songs of Chrysanthemum".

chrysanthemum
Source glyph
chrysanthemum
Name meaning
: Refers to chrysanthemum. The flowers in various poses, the Aoshuang fights snow, the independent cold autumn, and the character that is not afraid of the severe cold make people doubly love. Plum, orchid, chrysanthemum and bamboo are collectively called the four gentlemen.
形声字。州(+)表意,篆书形体像草,表示菊是草本类植物;匆(jd)表声,匆有满握、满捧义,表示菊花花朵形体较大。
本义是菊花。
菊花,多年生草本植物,秋天开花,品种很多,可供观赏。
~灯 ~花 ~科 ~石~坛 ~芋 茶~ 白~

jú
菊
菊。

Пиктофонетические символы.
Состояние (+) означает, что шрифт печати подобен траве, указывая на то, что хризантема является травянистым растением; звук спешки (jd) полон силы и смысла, указывая на то, что цветок хризантемы больше по форме.
Первоначальное значение - хризантема.
Хризантема - многолетнее растение, цветет осенью, есть много разновидностей для просмотра.

писец
jú
хризантема
Radicals: 艹, 勹, 米  (flowers, prison, rice)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you pick certain rice or flowers you'll be put in prison. The most famous of these is the chrysanthemum. Chrysanthemums are super important in Japan because they're the symbol of the imperial family. They're even on the cover of Japanese passports. If you get caught picking a chrysanthemum, you're going to prison.
Chrysanthemums are really important to the Japanese people. Please don't ever pick them (or rice, because that's stealing food, someone planted that)!
Reading Mnemonic
If you go to prison for chrysanthemum picking, everyone in the prison is going to kick (きく) you nonstop. You broke the chrysanthemum picking law, so kicking is your punishment. And believe me, you don't want these kicks.
Imagine holding a chrysanthemum in your hands while you get kicked over and over and over in prison. Was it worth it?
